column4: hmm i cant get the nvidia driver work ... only vesa is running with my custom kernel, maybe why only vesa is in kernel ... i installed the driver from nvidia.com ... what must i change in the Xfree config do get them work ?
you can probably find a lot of stuff on google if you search nvidia and xorg
all the changes are done, nvidia is at etc/modules  glx-config is enable, xfreeconfig -4 is edit .. *hmm* any ide's ?
are you using hoary or warty?
oh.  yeah so it's still xfreeconfig-4..what does /var/log/Xfree86*.log say?
the log only shows the last free start or ?
well, it should tell you how it's starting and whether it loaded everything correctly, you should look for EE stuff in the log
ok found this > (EE) Failed to initialize GLX extension (NVIDIA X driver not found)
did you load the glx module?
and also did lsmod | grep nvidia show up?
no, check to see if it loaded the nvidia kernel module
lsmod | grep nvidia
rmmod vesa and nvidia and then do modprobe nvidia
but make sure in your Xfree86config file you have Module "glx" also in there.  Is uspect you do.
so maybe you don't have vesa installed..do a modprobe nvidia again
GLcore should be commented out
but you should also have a module called glx
and I'm referring to the X module, not kernel
so in Section "Module" you should have a Load "glx"
you don't need to show me the whole thing
a yes or no is sufficient
so I'm not sure whats the cause is here is.  I'd google around some and look at your log and maybe search the error in google
that what I usually do.
